original_title: Carlos Braithwaite, Chris Lynn among top international players for LPL Player Auction
original_body_lines: West Indian T20 World Cup winner Carlos Braithwaite and Australian batsman Chris Lynn are among the star international players who will be up for auction for the upcoming LPL season, when franchises bid at the player auction on Wednesday.
360 players, both foreign and local, have registered for the auctions and franchises will be allowed to buy upto six international when the auction takes place.

"The players up for auction have been designated into 51 sets. After the players in the first 21 sets are drafted, the remaining players, and those who were not drafted, will be considered for the accelarated draft round. Each franchise will nominate 10 players each, and those 50 players will be up for auction in the accelarated draft, with the rest discarded," LPL Tournament Director Samantha Dodanwela told the Daily Mirror.
Each franchise will be allowed to pick between 20 and 24 players for their respective squads.
